Option.Name: Straight Sword / Greatsword / Ultra Greatsword / Whip
One hand down and behind hip

behaviorVariationId.Wiki: Used when determining the action parameter ID to be referenced during an attack

sortId.Wiki: Sort ID (-1: Do not collect) (7 digits is the limit in s32 to add the enhancement level in the program)

wanderingEquipId.Wiki: Replacement equipment ID for wandering ghosts.

weaponWeightRate.Wiki: Used in determining action cancel timing in TAE.\n0 is soonest, 1 is latest.

fixPrice.Wiki: This is the amount of souls it will take to fix this item.

basicPrice.Wiki: The base soul cost it will take to reinforce this item.\nScales with each consecutive upgrade.

sellValue.Wiki: The souls given when this item is sold.

correctStrength.Wiki: The base scaling value used for Strength.\nNote that this is multiplied by reinforcement (via ReinforceParamWeapon).

correctAgility.Wiki: The base scaling value used for Dexterity.\nNote that this is multiplied by reinforcement (via ReinforceParamWeapon).

corretMagic.Wiki: The base scaling value used for Intelligence.\nNote that this is multiplied by reinforcement (via ReinforceParamWeapon).

corretFaith.Wiki: The base scaling value used for Faith.\nNote that this is multiplied by reinforcement (via ReinforceParamWeapon).

physGuardCutRate.Wiki: The Physical absorption to use when guarding.

magGuardCutRate.Wiki: The Magic absorption to use when guarding.

fireGuardCutRate.Wiki: The Fire absorption to use when guarding.

thunGuardCutRate.Wiki: The Lightning absorption to use when guarding.

spEffectBehaviorId0.Wiki: The SpEffect to apply to the enemy on hit.

spEffectBehaviorId1.Wiki: The SpEffect to apply to the enemy on hit.

spEffectBehaviorId2.Wiki: The SpEffect to apply to the enemy on hit.

residentSpEffectId0.Wiki: The SpEffect to apply passively to the player while holding the item in an active hand.

residentSpEffectId1.Wiki: The SpEffect to apply passively to the player while holding the item in an active hand.

residentSpEffectId2.Wiki: The SpEffect to apply passively to the player while holding the item in an active hand.

materialSetId.Wiki: Determines the EquipMtrlSetParam row range used for reinforcement.

originEquipWep0.Wiki: Contains the base weapon ID.\nDetermines the max reinforcement level and what an infused weapon returns to when uninfused.

originEquipWep1.Wiki: Contains the base weapon ID.\nDetermines the max reinforcement level and what an infused weapon returns to when uninfused.

originEquipWep2.Wiki: Contains the base weapon ID.\nDetermines the max reinforcement level and what an infused weapon returns to when uninfused.

originEquipWep3.Wiki: Contains the base weapon ID.\nDetermines the max reinforcement level and what an infused weapon returns to when uninfused.

originEquipWep4.Wiki: Contains the base weapon ID.\nDetermines the max reinforcement level and what an infused weapon returns to when uninfused.

originEquipWep5.Wiki: Contains the base weapon ID.\nDetermines the max reinforcement level and what an infused weapon returns to when uninfused.

originEquipWep6.Wiki: Contains the base weapon ID.\nDetermines the max reinforcement level and what an infused weapon returns to when uninfused.

originEquipWep7.Wiki: Contains the base weapon ID.\nDetermines the max reinforcement level and what an infused weapon returns to when uninfused.

originEquipWep8.Wiki: Contains the base weapon ID.\nDetermines the max reinforcement level and what an infused weapon returns to when uninfused.

originEquipWep9.Wiki: Contains the base weapon ID.\nDetermines the max reinforcement level and what an infused weapon returns to when uninfused.

originEquipWep10.Wiki: Contains the base weapon ID.\nDetermines the max reinforcement level and what an infused weapon returns to when uninfused.

originEquipWep11.Wiki: Contains the base weapon ID.\nDetermines the max reinforcement level and what an infused weapon returns to when uninfused.

originEquipWep12.Wiki: Contains the base weapon ID.\nDetermines the max reinforcement level and what an infused weapon returns to when uninfused.

originEquipWep13.Wiki: Contains the base weapon ID.\nDetermines the max reinforcement level and what an infused weapon returns to when uninfused.

originEquipWep14.Wiki: Contains the base weapon ID.\nDetermines the max reinforcement level and what an infused weapon returns to when uninfused.

originEquipWep15.Wiki: Contains the base weapon ID.\nDetermines the max reinforcement level and what an infused weapon returns to when uninfused.

weakA_DamageRate.Wiki: Damage multiplier for special attack A

weakB_DamageRate.Wiki: Damage multiplier for special attack B

weakC_DamageRate.Wiki: Damage multiplier for special attack C

weakD_DamageRate.Wiki: Damage multiplier for special attack D

equipModelId.Wiki: The part model ID. Determines the part model used by the weapon.

durability.Wiki: Determines how quickly durability is drained by attacking.\nLower is faster.

durailityMax.Wiki: This the maximum durability, it will be shown in the game GUI

attackThrowEscape.Wiki: Basic value of throw-through attack power

parryDamageLife.Wiki: Limit the life of parry damage. It does not last longer than it is set in TimeAct.

atkBasePhysics.Wiki: The base Physical damage.\nNote that this is multiplied by reinforcement (via ReinforceParamWeapon).

atkBaseMagic.Wiki: The base Magic damage.\nNote that this is multiplied by reinforcement (via ReinforceParamWeapon).

atkBaseFire.Wiki: The base Fire damage.\nNote that this is multiplied by reinforcement (via ReinforceParamWeapon).

atkBaseThunder.Wiki: The base Lightning damage.\nNote that this is multiplied by reinforcement (via ReinforceParamWeapon).

atkBaseStamina.Wiki: The base Stamina damage that is applied to an enemy when guarding.\nNote that this is multiplied by reinforcement (via ReinforceParamWeapon).

saWeaponDamage.Wiki: The base Poise damage.\nNote that this is multiplied by reinforcement (via ReinforceParamWeapon).

saDurability.Wiki: Additional SA durability used during attack motion

guardAngle.Wiki: Defense occurrence range angle when guarding weapons

staminaGuardDef.Wiki: Defense against enemy stamina attacks when guarding successfully

trophySGradeId.Wiki: Is it related to the trophy system?

bowDistRate.Wiki: The bow distance added to ammunition range.\nValue given is percent difference from 50.\nExample: Value -30 gives 35 range ingame (50 + (50 * -0.3)) = 50 - 15 = 35

wepmotionCategory.Wiki: Determines the base moveset used by the weapon. Corresponds to TAE ID.

guardmotionCategory.Wiki: Determines the moveset used whilst guarding.

atkMaterial.Wiki: Attack material used from attack para

defSfxMaterial.Wiki: Defense SE material used from attack para 1

correctType.Wiki: Determines the stat graph used for Physical damage (i.e. how effective a stat is).\nAlso affects STR/DEX portion of Spell Buff if applicable (Does not appear).

spAtkCategory.Wiki: Determines the override moveset used by the weapon. Corresponds to TAE ID.

attackBaseParry.Wiki: If this is greater than defender's Parry Defense, the attack cannot be parried.

defenseBaseParry.Wiki: If this is equal to or greater than attacker's Parry Attack, the attack can be parried.

guardBaseRepel.Wiki: If this is greater than attacker's Flick Attack, the attack is deflected and damage is reduced by 50%.

attackBaseRepel.Wiki: If this is greater than defender's Passive/Guard Flick, the attack is not deflected.\nAtkParam can modify this value.

guardCutCancelRate.Wiki: Percentage of target's current guard rate to bypass.\nGuard bypass starts at 255 for 1 percent bypass to 156 for 100 percent bypass.\n(Needs testing) Values of 1 to 100 will increase guarding effectiveness.

guardLevel.Wiki: When guarding, which guard motion will the enemy attack? Decide

slashGuardCutRate.Wiki: Looking at the attack type, what percentage of the damage of the slashing attribute is cut? Specify

blowGuardCutRate.Wiki: Looking at the attack type, what percentage of the damage of the hit attribute is cut? Specify

thrustGuardCutRate.Wiki: Looking at the attack type, what percentage of the damage of the piercing attribute is cut? Specify

poisonGuardResist.Wiki: How much to cut the attack power to poison (set to the special effect parameter)

toxicGuardResist.Wiki: How much to cut the attack power (set as a special effect parameter) to make it a plague

bloodGuardResist.Wiki: How much to cut the attack power (set as a special effect parameter) to make bleeding

curseGuardResist.Wiki: How much to cut the attack power (set as a special effect parameter) to curse

rightHandEquipable.Wiki: Is it possible to equip it with the right hand?

leftHandEquipable.Wiki: Is it possible to equip it with the left hand?

bothHandEquipable.Wiki: Is it possible to equip with both hands?

arrowSlotEquipable.Wiki: Is it possible to equip a bow bullet?

boltSlotEquipable.Wiki: Is it possible to equip a crossbow bullet?

enableGuard.Wiki: Determines whether this weapon can be affected by shield buffs such as Magic Shield.

enableParry.Wiki: Determines whether this weapon can parry (requires TAE support for actual effect).

enableMagic.Wiki: Determines whether this weapon can cast Sorceries\nRequires HKS or TAE support for actual effect.

enablePyromancy.Wiki: Determines whether this weapon can cast Pyromancies\nRequires HKS or TAE support for actual effect.

enableMiracle.Wiki: Determines whether this weapon can cast Miracles\nRequires HKS or TAE support for actual effect.

enableVowMagic.Wiki: Determines whether this weapon can cast Vow Magic (Magic 4).\nRequires HKS or TAE support for actual effect.

isNormalAttackType.Wiki: Attack type for menu display. Is it normal?

isBlowAttackType.Wiki: Attack type for menu display. Is it a blow?

isSlashAttackType.Wiki: Attack type for menu display. Is it a slash?

isThrustAttackType.Wiki: Attack type for menu display. Is it a piercing?

isEnhance.Wiki: Determines whether this weapon can be buffed via SpEffects.

isHeroPointCorrect.Wiki: Is there an attack power correction by human nature?

isCustom.Wiki: Listed in the enhancement target list at the enhancement shop (may be deleted due to specification changes?)

isDarkHand.Wiki: Allows Dark Hand shield VFX to display when Jumptable 85 is active.

simpleModelForDlc.Wiki: Is there a simple model for DLC?

isVersusGhostWep.Wiki: NPC Para's spirit body will now hit the opponent of . Also, the attack para Is it a ghost attack? Will be able to guard the attack of .

infusion_icon_a.Wiki:
Infusion A/B/C/D determines infusion ico.
FFFF Normal
TFFF Heavy
FTFF Sharp
TTFF Refined
FFTF Crystal
TFTF Simple
FTTF Fire
TTTF Chaos
FFFT Lightning
TFFT Deep
FTFT Dark
TTFT Poison
FFTT Blood
TFTT Raw
FTTT Blessed
TTTT Hollow

Infusion A/B/C/D determines infusion icon.
FFFF Normal
TFFF Heavy
FTFF Sharp
TTFF Refined
FFTF Crystal
TFTF Simple
FTTF Fire
TTTF Chaos
FFFT Lightning
TFFT Deep
FTFT Dark
TTFT Poison
FFTT Blood
TFTT Raw
FTTT Blessed
TTTT Hollow

Infusion A/B/C/D determines infusion icon.

TFFF Heavy

FTTF Fire
TTTF Chaos

Infusion A/B/C/D determines infusion icon.

TFFF Heavy
FTFF Sharp
TTFF Refined

infusion_icon_e.Wiki: If E is true and A/B/C/D are false, this is an extra infusion with its own icon and event flag.

infusion_icon_f.Wiki: Technically infusion related but has no associated icons or event flags, so it's basically non-functional.

DisableShoot.Wiki: Flags weapon/ammo to use alt set (i.e. greatbows and greatarrows).

showLogCondType.Wiki: Whether to display in the item acquisition log when acquiring the item (not entered: )

enableThrow.Wiki: Whether it is a throwable weapon

showDialogCondType.Wiki: Whether to display it in the item acquisition dialog when acquiring an item (not entered: new only)

disableGemAttr.Wiki: Is it prohibited to change the magic stone attribute?

defSfxMaterial1.Wiki: Defensive SFX material used from attack para 1

defSfxMaterial2.Wiki: Defensive SFX material used from attack para 2

defSeMaterial2.Wiki: Defense SE material used from attack para 2

absorpParamId.Wiki: Weapon adsorption position parameter Id. This value determines the position where the weapon is attracted (-1: Refer to the value written directly in the old source code).

toughnessCorrectRate.Wiki: Determines the multiplier to apply to Toughness (when applied via InvokeToughness in TAE).

isValidTough_ProtSADmg.AltName: Is Toughness Perfomed if Poise is Initial Value
isValidTough_ProtSADmg.Wiki: Whether the toughness calculation is performed even if the armor SA is the initial value. Check the toughness specification .xlsx for details

isDualBlade.Wiki: This determines whether the item is a paired weapon.\nEffects include enabling the L1 moveset when 2 handing and changing the animation played when 2 handing.\nThis animation can be changed or reverted in HKS.

isAutoEquip.Wiki: Automatically equips the item when picked up, if slots are empty.

correctType_Magic.Wiki: Determines the stat graph used for Magic damage (i.e. how effective a stat is).\nAlso affects INT portion of Spell buff if applicable.

correctType_Fire.Wiki: Determines the stat graph used for Fire damage (i.e. how effective a stat is).

correctType_Thunder.Wiki: Determines the stat graph used for Lightning damage (i.e. how effective a stat is).\nAlso affects FTH portion of Spell buff if applicable.

weakE_DamageRate.Wiki: Damage multiplier for special attack E

weakF_DamageRate.Wiki: Damage multiplier for special attack F

darkGuardCutRate.Wiki: The Dark absorption to use when guarding.

atkBaseDark.Wiki: The base Dark damage.\nNote that this is multiplied by reinforcement (via ReinforceParamWeapon).

correctType_Dark.Wiki: Determines the stat graph used for Dark damage (i.e. how effective a stat is).

correctType_Poison.Wiki: Determines the stat graph used for Poison buildup (i.e. how effective a stat is).

swordArt_ActId.Wiki: Set to 99 for Torch to make it have No Skill. 0 otherwise.

correctType_Bleed.Wiki: Determine the type of bleeding attack power correction graph with primary parameters

freezeGuardResist.Wiki: How much to cut the attack power (set to the special effect parameter) to cool down

autoReplenishType.Wiki: Controls whether or not to automatically replenish and default settings

arrowBoltEquipId.Wiki: Equipment number of the quiver (magazine) display model. In the case of a bow, it is displayed as a quiver, and in the case of a crossbow, it is displayed as a magazine.

DerivationLevelType.Wiki: Type of how to set the enhancement level when returning or deriving a weapon

displayTypeId.Wiki: This is the weapon class displayed in the in-game menu. Reference ManuValueTableParam.

physGuardCutRate_MaxCorrect.Wiki: Max bonus possible. Scaling handled by CalcCorrectGraph 160.\nScales with DEX and is affected by DEX requirement.

magGuardCutRate_MaxCorrect.Wiki: Max bonus possible. Scaling handled by CalcCorrectGraph 161.\nScales with DEX and is affected by DEX requirement.

fireGuardCutRate_MaxCorrect.Wiki: Max bonus possible. Scaling handled by CalcCorrectGraph 161.\nScales with DEX and is affected by DEX requirement.

thunGuardCutRate_MaxCorrect.Wiki: Max bonus possible. Scaling handled by CalcCorrectGraph 161.\nScales with DEX and is affected by DEX requirement.

darkGuardCutRate_MaxCorrect.Wiki: Max bonus possible. Scaling handled by CalcCorrectGraph 161.\nScales with DEX and is affected by DEX requirement.

poisonGuardResist_MaxCorrect.Wiki: Max bonus possible. Scaling handled by CalcCorrectGraph 162.\nScales with DEX and is affected by DEX requirement.

diseaseGuardResist_MaxCorrect.Wiki: Max bonus possible. Scaling handled by CalcCorrectGraph 162.\nScales with DEX and is affected by DEX requirement.

bloodGuardResist_MaxCorrect.Wiki: Max bonus possible. Scaling handled by CalcCorrectGraph 162.\nScales with DEX and is affected by DEX requirement.

curseGuardResist_MaxCorrect.Wiki: Max bonus possible. Scaling handled by CalcCorrectGraph 162.\nScales with DEX and is affected by DEX requirement.

freezeGuardResist_MaxCorrect.Wiki: Max bonus possible. Scaling handled by CalcCorrectGraph 162.\nScales with DEX and is affected by DEX requirement.

staminaGuardDef_MaxCorrect.Wiki: Max bonus possible. Scaling handled by CalcCorrectGraph 163.\nScales with STR and is affected by STR requirement.

weaponVfx4.Wiki: Dummy ID at which to position VFX ID 1

weaponVfx5.Wiki: Dummy ID at which to position VFX ID 2

weaponVfx6.Wiki: Dummy ID at which to position VFX ID 3

weaponVfx7.Wiki: Dummy ID at which to position VFX ID 4

StaminaConsumeRate.Wiki: Multiplier applied to the stamina costs defined in behavior.

vsPlayerDmgCorrectRate_Physics.Wiki: Only attacks on the player will correct the damage done.

vsPlayerDmgCorrectRate_Magic.Wiki: Only attacks on the player will correct the damage done.

vsPlayerDmgCorrectRate_Fire.Wiki: Only attacks on the player will correct the damage done.

vsPlayerDmgCorrectRate_Thunder.Wiki: Only attacks on the player will correct the damage done.

vsPlayerDmgCorrectRate_Dark.Wiki: Only attacks on the player will correct the damage done.

vsPlayerDmgCorrectRate_Poison.Wiki: Only attacks on the player will correct the damage done.

vsPlayerDmgCorrectRate_Blood.Wiki: Only attacks on the player will correct the damage done.

vsPlayerDmgCorrectRate_Freeze.Wiki: Only attacks on the player will correct the damage done.

attackElementCorrectId.Wiki: ID of the parameter that corrects the attack attribute

reinforceShopCategory.Wiki: Determines what options are available when reinforcing weapons.\nHandled through event flags/ESD.

residentSfx_1_IsVisibleForHang.Wiki: If Do you want to display when resident SFX1 is delivered? Is true, hide the SFX set to resident SFX ID1 when the weapon is delivered.

residentSfx_2_IsVisibleForHang.Wiki: If Do you want to display when resident SFX2 is delivered? Is true, hide the SFX set to resident SFX ID2 when the weapon is delivered.

residentSfx_3_IsVisibleForHang.Wiki: If Do you want to display when resident SFX3 is delivered? Is true, hide the SFX set to resident SFX ID3 when the weapon is delivered.

residentSfx_4_IsVisibleForHang.Wiki: If Do you want to display when resident SFX4 is delivered? Is true, hide the SFX set to resident SFX ID 4 when the weapon is delivered.

isSoulParamIdChange_model0.Wiki: Whether the vfx parameter Soul Param ID for Weapon Enchantment and Invisible Weapon for Weapon Enchantment settings are applied

isSoulParamIdChange_model1.Wiki: Whether the vfx parameter Soul Param ID for Weapon Enchantment and Invisible Weapon for Weapon Enchantment settings are applied

isSoulParamIdChange_model2.Wiki: Whether the vfx parameter Soul Param ID for Weapon Enchantment and Invisible Weapon for Weapon Enchantment settings are applied

isSoulParamIdChange_model3.Wiki: Whether the vfx parameter Soul Param ID for Weapon Enchantment and Invisible Weapon for Weapon Enchantment settings are applied
